## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I have a few more questions about using VerusIDs. How do I unlock an ID without setting a timelock or time delay?

**AI Assistant:**
Unfortunately, it's not possible to unlock an ID without setting a timelock or time delay. The timelock parameter is used to define the unlock height of the identity or the delay before an ID is unlocked when the flags are set back to an unlocked state. There is no way to bypass this mechanism and unlock an ID without setting a timelock or time delay.

**User:**
That's good to know. Another question I had is, can a locked identity revoke itself?

**AI Assistant:**
No, a locked identity cannot revoke itself. Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. So, if you want to revoke a locked identity, you'll need to follow the standard revocation process, which will automatically remove the lock.
How do I unlock an ID without setting a timelock or time delay?

You can't unlock an ID without setting a timelock or time delay. The timelock parameter is used to define the unlock height of the identity or the delay before an ID is unlocked when the flags are set back to an unlocked state. There is no way to unlock an ID without setting a timelock or time delay.

k is fractal, enabling an unlimited number of simultaneously operating, interoperable blockchains.
## Locking and Unlocking IDs
- **Time Lock:**
  The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.
  ```
  verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'
  ```
- **Time Delay:**
  The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.
  ```
  verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'
  ```
- Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height.
- A locked identity cannot revoke itself.
## Conversion Queries
The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves
- **E.g. BTC ETH:**
  ```
  verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth
  ```
  Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.
Can a locked identity revoke itself?
No, a locked identity cannot revoke itself. Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height.
